document.discussion_title: Jury delivers prison sequel for mortician who inspired ‘Bernie’ film
document.topic_text: Jury delivers prison sequel for mortician who inspired ‘Bernie’ film American-Statesman Sunday 24th April, 2016 Bernie Tiede, whose murder case was the basis for a 2011 film by Austin director Richard Linklater, is headed back to prison.Jurors deliberated for about 4? hours before sentencing Tiede, a former East Texas mortician, to 99 years to life in prison on Friday night after a new sentencing trial for his 1999 conviction in the killing of widow Marjorie Nugent.Tiede, originally given life in prison, had been incarcerated nearly 16 years when he was temporarily freed in 2014 after his original prosecutor, Danny Buck Davidson, said he believed Tiede deserved a lesser sentence because of new evidence ...
